alert.note: Alert for DeSoto; Hardee; Sumter (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Watch issued November 09 at 3:50AM EST until further notice by NWS Tampa Bay
info.description: .As Tropical Storm Nicole moves across the Florida Peninsula over the next couple of days, the threat and potential for heavy rainfall will increase. Rainfall amounts of 2 to 4 inches with locally higher amounts will be possible. ...FLOOD WATCH NOW IN EFFECT FROM 1 PM EST THIS AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE THURSDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues to be possible. * WHERE...A portion of west central Florida, including the following counties, DeSoto, Hardee, Highlands, Polk and Sumter. * WHEN...From 1 PM EST this afternoon through late Thursday night. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - https://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
